title: examples/slds.py is broken
body:
Hello! I git clone this repo and installed according to instruction.
Here's my dependencies:

```
pyro-ppl                                1.4.0
pyro-api                                0.1.2
torch                                     1.6.0
numpy                                   1.18.5
```

My Python version is 3.6. 

When I run `python examples/slds.py`, I get the following message:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "examples/slds.py", line 81, in <module>
    main(args)
  File "examples/slds.py", line 64, in main
    log_prob = model(data)
  File ".../miniconda3/lib/python3.6/contextlib.py", line 52, in inner
    return func(*args, **kwds)
  File "examples/slds.py", line 42, in model
    log_prob += dist.Categorical(trans_probs[s_prev], value=s_curr)
  File ".../funsor/funsor/distribution.py", line 61, in __call__
    value = to_funsor(value, output=cls._infer_value_domain(**{k: v.output for k, v in kwargs.items()}))
  File ".../funsor/funsor/distribution.py", line 161, in _infer_value_domain
    validate_args=False)
  File "../miniconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/distributions/categorical.py", line 48, in __init__
    if probs.dim() < 1:
AttributeError: 'numpy.ndarray' object has no attribute 'dim'
```

I tried other versions of Torch but doesn't seem to be fixing anything...
